title: Compound Interest Formula
text: We have the compound interest formula $$A(t)={P\left(1+\frac{r}{n}\right)}^{nt}$$

title: Find the Values of the Variables
text: The nominal interest rate is 6%, so $$𝑟=0.06$$. Interest is compounded twice a year, so $$n=2$$. The value of the account will be worth $40,000 in $$18$$ years, so $$A(t)=40000$$ and $$t=18$$.

title: Substitute the Value
text: Substitute the values into the formula to get the answer.
